For Agencies For Businesses Case Studies About

Case Study

St. Louis Lambert International Airport

Led FlySTL’s API-connected, accessible WordPress rebuild with live travel data widgets and Kadence/ACF layouts that keep passengers informed.

Visit live site

Challenge

What they needed

Lambert Airport’s public site hadn’t kept pace with traveler expectations: flight status, TSA, parking, and concessions data lived in disconnected systems, navigation was confusing, and the previous theme couldn’t meet the stricter accessibility and multilingual requirements.

Approach

How we solved it

Partnered with Kestrel and Dovetail to rebuild FlySTL with a WordPress theme. Wired Kadence + ACF blocks for every layout and layered Alpine.js components that talk to flight, TSA, and parking APIs. Built flight-status and search modules that hydrate from the airport feed and parking cards that query SuperParkingLot in real time. Hardened navigation with accessible mega menus, header tab panels, ReciteMe + Google Translate helpers, and skip-link/keyboard patterns. Implemented custom post types so the airport team can manage updates without engineers.

Completed

November 2025

Website

https://www.flystl.com/

Stack highlights

  • WordPress
  • Tailwind CSS
  • Advanced Custom Fields
  • Kadence
  • Alpine.js
  • REST API
  • PHP
  • Gravity Forms
  • Accessibility
